skill.name: spawn-parallel
skill.description: Pattern for spawning parallel subagents efficiently. Use when you need multiple independent tasks done concurrently.
skill.summary: Pattern for spawning parallel subagents efficiently. Use when you need multiple independent tasks do...
skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown patterns for parallel AI subagent orchestration. No executable code, network calls, or file operations. All 30 static findings are false positives: 'C2 keywords' from 'spawn' terminology, 'crypto algorithms' from pattern matching errors, 'backtick execution' from markdown code formatting, and 'hidden file access' from metadata URL fields.

content.value_statement: Running multiple AI tasks sequentially wastes time. This pattern lets you spawn parallel subagents to work concurrently, dramatically reducing total execution time for independent tasks.
actual_capabilities: Spawn multiple subagents in parallel using single response
Coordinate independent tasks without file conflicts
Handle failures with retry and escalation strategies
Define clear file ownership boundaries per agent
limitations: Requires truly independent tasks with no data dependencies
Cannot safely modify same files across parallel agents
Limited to dotagent ecosystem subagent types
Results only available after all agents complete

use_cases.title: Parallel Code Exploration
use_cases.description: Explore authentication, API routes, and database models simultaneously to understand codebase structure faster.

use_cases.title: Multi-Service Deployment
use_cases.description: Deploy frontend, backend, and database changes concurrently while maintaining clear service boundaries.

use_cases.title: Parallel Test Execution
use_cases.description: Run unit tests, integration tests, and security scans in parallel to speed up CI/CD pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Parallel Spawn
prompt_templates.prompt: Spawn 3 explorer agents to analyze src/auth, src/api, and src/db concurrently. Return findings as compact JSON.

prompt_templates.title: Mixed Agent Types
prompt_templates.prompt: Spawn implementer for user validation with ownership of validators/ and email service with ownership of services/ with read-only access to shared types.

prompt_templates.title: Failure Recovery
prompt_templates.prompt: Spawn parallel agents with retry logic. If any fail after 3 attempts, record failure and continue with successful agents.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: Spawn explorers to find issues, then spawn implementers to fix them in parallel with contract-resolver for conflicts.

output_examples.input: Spawn 3 parallel explorers for auth, API, and database analysis
output: ✓ Authentication explorer: Found 5 auth middlewares, 3 providers
✓ API explorer: Discovered 12 endpoints, 2 rate limiters

best_practices: Define clear file ownership boundaries to prevent conflicts between parallel agents
Use haiku model for fast exploration tasks and sonnet for complex implementation work
Always validate outputs and implement failure handling before proceeding with dependent tasks
anti_patterns: Spawning agents that modify the same files causes conflicts and potential data loss
Creating dependencies between parallel tasks defeats the purpose of concurrency
Ignoring failure handling means one failed agent can stop the entire batch

faq.question: Which subagent types can I spawn in parallel?
faq.answer: explorer, implementer, verifier, and tester agents are supported. Use explorer for fast scouting and implementer for coding work.

faq.question: How many parallel agents can I spawn at once?
faq.answer: No hard limit exists, but practical maximum is 5-10 agents. More agents create diminishing returns and increase coordination overhead.

faq.question: Can parallel agents share data or files?
faq.answer: Yes, with read-only access to shared resources. Each agent should have exclusive write access to prevent conflicts.

faq.question: What happens if one agent fails?
faq.answer: Other agents continue running. Failed agents are retried up to 3 times with enhanced context before being recorded as failed.

faq.question: How do I prevent agents from conflicting?
faq.answer: Define clear file ownership in boundaries, use contracts for shared interfaces, and ensure tasks are truly independent.

faq.question: Is this compatible with standard Claude Code agents?
faq.answer: No, this pattern uses custom dotagent agents. Built-in Claude Code agents like Explore have different behavior.
